newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil mainly stronger, prompt barges weaker.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil mainly stronger, prompt barges weaker.

text.p: NWE gas oil was generally stronger on Thursday with higher futures and firm premiums on cargoes. But Prompt barge material was weaker, traders said.
A barge traded at IPE Sept +25 fob antwerp. Premiums were put at IPE Sept screen flat/+$75 per tonne, fob Rotterdam for second half August and +50 cents/+$1.50 for first half Sept.
On the cargoes, traders said buying interest in low sulphur material was hotting up ahead of the introduction of EU 0.05 percent diesel rules in October.
Premiums were put at IPE Sept +$4.0/+$5.0 fob NWE and IPE Sept +$11/+$12.
A cargo was offered out of Norway at IPE Oct +$4.50.
Traders said a 30,000 tonne cargo of Canadian gas oil was on the water and probably heading for the Mediterranean. They said it had been offered at IPE Oct IPE +12.50, basis Lavera.

Premiums on Russian material were put at IPE Sept $+1.0/+$2.0 per tonne, cif NWE. Traders said demand in the region for Russian material was a bit slack but transatlantic arbitrage opportunities were good and a trading house was working a 90,000 tonne cargo to the U.S.
German demand for heating oil was also stronger. Premiums rose 50 cents to IPE Sept +$4.0/+$4.50.-London +44 171 542 7714.
